title: three bed flat sale just
story: Three-bed flat on sale for just £, as buyers joke decorator was on LSDThe eccentric home in Glasgow is a random collection of childlike patterns and every colour of the rainbow, leaving potential buyers confusedInside the house is an interesting colour scheme Image: RightmoveByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA three-bed cottage flat has gone on sale for just £, but the buyers are warned it might give you a headache, as some joked the decorator was on LSD when he painted it. The eccentric home is a random collection of childlike patterns and every colour of the rainbow. The combination of bright hues, swirly patterns, dot work and odd, out of place shapes on the walls and ceilings gives the flat a hallucinatory feel. There are also random images of famous people such as Elvis Presley, Nelson Mandela, Marilyn Monroe and, perhaps most bizarrely, Princess Diana, on the walls. Viewers of the Rightmove home, in Glasgow, Scotland, joked it could be the abode of lentil-loving hippie character Neil Pye from cult aposs Beeb sitcom The Young Ones.Even Westgate Estate Agents admits it requires a degree of cosmetic upgrading. One viewer - known only as Steven - said: Neil from The Young Ones is selling his flat in Glasgow. The weirdest bit is the picture of Princess Di in the middle of it all. He added: It is a great spot and price. Someone will get a pretty good place once itaposs gutted. Another bloke said: The place, the view, the price.... all pretty decent. But many grands needed to remove the psychedelic, drug crazed, decor.  Gave me a headache looking at the pics. And I like mad and bold stuff. Not groovy. He also quipped: Neilaposs place is a great description of it. Heavyyy. Alison Brook joked: Thereaposs nowt wrong with that house that sunglasses or a wrecking ball couldnapost fix! One house hunter said: Holy c**p, did someone slip the decorator LSD  Another bloke - Ewan - added: Bit too Scooby Doo for me.  The estate agents present it as a development opportunity. They added: We are delighted to offer for sale this three bedroom, upper cottage flat, situated within the sought after Kingspark district of the Southside of Glasgow. Read more Requires a degree of cosmetic upgrading yet offers spacious accommodation in a popular locale. The property comprises: welcoming reception hallway, generous lounge, with a picture window, kitchen.There are three, well-proportioned bedrooms, all of which have space for additional free standing furniture as required and bathroom.The property benefits UPVC double glazed windows, gas central heating with a modern combination boiler and private gardens. title: aldi shopper shares how cashiers
story: Aldi shopper shares how cashiers scan items so fast - as many cant figure it outAn Aldi shopper has claimed theyve learned the real reason why employees at the supermarket are able to scan your items so fast at the tills - and its to do with the packagingStaff at the checkout are super speedyImage: Bloomberg via Getty ImagesByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsItaposs a truth universally acknowledged that staff at the checkouts in Aldi are incredibly speedy and keeping up with them can be a real struggle. Often youaposll be asked to pay for all your groceries before youaposve even got half of them into your bags.Weaposve seen a number of hacks over the years to make packing shopping at Aldi easier - such as putting all your items into a giant basket instead of inidual bags. And weaposve also heard about hacks to try and slow down the cashiers, but have you ever wondered why theyaposre so fast  One woman on TikTok claims to have solved the mystery - and says many people donapost realise the reason.Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. A TikTok user named Sam, who posts under @glutenfreesam, shared all in a video that went viral explaining why she thinks the checkout workers are so fast.She said: Fun fact: Aldi product packaging is designed to have multiple barcodes so that cashiers can scan things faster, all about that speed baby. More than , people have watched the clip, with it garnering over , likes. Dozens of users have also commented on the video, with many sharing that they didnapost know about the packaging and that the aposfun factapos made lots of sense. Wait that’s actually so smart, replied one person. Another wrote: I could never figure out how they do it so quick. Iaposm always trying to match their speed while unloading my cart. A third said: Broooo….that’s so smart and I always wondered how they went so effing fast. Someone  posted: Also most types of packaging have barcodes in the same relative areas. While an Aldi employee added that they loved impressing people with their speed at the till, saying: This is the most satisfying part of my job. I love when people are amazed by my speed.Do you have a shopping tip or trick to share  We pay for stories. title: best dog trims crufts 2020
story: Best dog haircuts at Crufts  - show-stopping styles and silky coatsCrufts , the worlds largest dog show, has entered its second day and spectators just cant get enough of the adorable dogs wandering around the show with their owners in towAn adorable old English sheepdog with cheek buns Image: GettyByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsAs Crufts makes its highly-anticipated , dog owners have been descending on Birmingham to show off their precious pooches. While there can only be one Best in Show, countless dogs have been impressing spectators with their silky coats, charming temperaments and outstanding obedience. Made to look their best, many dogs have been treated to a trip to the groomers before their arrival at the worldaposs largest dog show, with some even showing up in dog-friendly clothing and accessories. To celebrate all things Crufts, we are sharing the show-stopping dog with the best trims who are sure to turn heads at this yearaposs competition.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  Spotted on the grooming table at the National Exhibition Centre, an old English sheepdog has been making spectators smile with their adorable cheeky buns and top knot. A brown Hungarian Puli, which has one of the most striving coats in the show ring, was seen snuggling with its owner as she made him show ready. According to The Kennel Club, the breed owes its origins to Hungarian herding dogs of the Far East, which accompanied the Magyars as they travelled west.  A statement reads: One of the Hungarian corded breeds, the puppy coat of loose flocks later cords naturally and provides insulation and protection. Underneath the coat the dog is lightly built and his nimble movement and agility made him fit for . Elsewhere, an adorable poodle was spotted on the grooming table before judges arrived to rate its spectacular coat, and a cheeky Afghan hound was seen having its hair brushed to look its best before its competition category.  When the competition ends on Sunday, Crufts will have been broadcasting for a record-breaking  hours across the UK on Channel and More. The celebrations officially kicked off at the launch on March , with Paralympics presenter, Sophie Morgan, announced as the new face of Crufts. Sophie said: Iaposm so happy Crufts is back! Every dog has its day at this amazing event and these three breeds making history are among them.  Almost all breeds will be represented at this yearaposs four-day event - including the smooth-faced Pyrenean Sheepdog who will be competing for the Best in Show title at Crufts for the first time ever. A Crufts statement reads: Organised by The Kennel Club, the show celebrates every aspect of the role that dogs play in our lives. Crufts has changed in ways that couldn’t possibly have been imagined when the show was set up in Victorian times by the late Charles Cruft.  Although it was a very dferent event in , Charles Cruft was a great showman and would surely have enjoyed the size and scope of the event today, which has become an essential date in any dog lover’s calendar. The dog show is still an important part of the event, celebrating the unique relationship that dogs share with their owners. Judges are trained to ensure that only healthy dogs win prizes, which in turn encourages the breeding of healthy dogs. Do you have a cute dog story to share  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: influencer debunks how perfect bikini
story: Influencer debunks how perfect bikini snaps are taken - and shares real bum insteadA body-positive Instagram star has been praised for her refreshing honesty, debunking how influencers taking the perfect bikini and highlighting how social media isnt always realityHayley has a very important message to share with followersByJulia BanimAudience WriterSamantha BartlettSenior Lestyle  Travel Reporter:,  Mar |comments As much as we might try and remind ourselves that social media isnapost reflective of reality, knowing full well that we shouldnapost beat ourselves up for falling short of aposperfectionapos, is easier said than done at times.So itaposs always good when a bonafide influencer comes forward to lt the curtain on what actually goes into getting those impossibly aposperfectapos shots, reminding you that what you see in the bathroom mirror is just as beautul.As previously reported by theDaily Star,personal trainer Hayley Madigan - who champions all things reality, health, body confidence and fitness - has now come forward to expose the truth on how certain influencers get their butt looking a certain way, using her own bottom as an example. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Using side-by-side pics, Hayley - who goes by the username @ hayleymadiganfitness - showed the dference between an Insta Pool Pose Vs What I see in the bathroom mirror, showing a posed pic next to what her bum looks like in reality.In a powerful caption, Hayley explained: Dferent poses, dferent camera angles, dferent posture, dferent lighting can all make a huge dference to how a body is perceived and more specically how you see your own body! You will see your body in all types of angles and poses. You will see your body relaxed and unposed. You will see yourself in many ways so do not let your eyes deceive you by telling you to feel negative towards your own body.  She continued: You have the power to change your mindset, to look at your own body in a kinder manner. To be kinder to yourself and to your mental health. To be kinder to your body, because it is your home and you only have one so treat it with the best kindness you can offer! We often pick holes in our bodies continuously but when you realise that no one worth having in your le wouldn’t ever pick those same holes about you is an important thing to remember. The people that care and love you do not see you the same way, all they see is the happiness, the love, and the sparkle that you bring to them and the world. You’re not just a body, you are YOU, so be kinder to yourself. Many people have been greatly touched by Hayleyaposs wise words, which are so very important in an age where le filtered through a social media lens can seriously impact the way we view our bodies.One person thanked Hayley for bringing some honesty to Instagram, really admire you for this, while another described her honesty as inspiring.A third person remarked that they wished such pics were shown in high schools, adding: I speak for myself around that age, I only saw the ‘perfect’ Instagram bodies. It’s easy to lose track of what is picture-perfect and what is real. I’d rather see everyday-perfect than picture-perfect more. Because we are perfect in our own way: every. single. one. of. us.Do you have a body positivity story to share  We pay for stories. title: i put full face make
story: I put on a full face of make-up to go home after C-section - I wanted to look goodA TikToker who goes by the name Zee Zee has shared her make-up routine after giving birth via C-section - and it includes contouring, eyeshadow and even  lashesZee Zee posted about how she wanted to make herself feel good after her C-section Image: @mamazeezeee TikTokByJessica TaylorReal Le Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsAlthough mothers adore their children, itaposs safe to say theyaposd all agree bringing their little ones into the world was no walk in the park. Going through labour and giving birth is just about the most painful experience a woman can go through - and many women are left traumatised afterwards. And when it comes to taking the baby home, a new mumaposs mind will be all over the place, worrying about car seats, sleeping and night feeds. So for most mums, the idea of putting on a full face of make-up just after giving birth would barely enter their headspace. But one new mum on TikTok begs to dfer. The mother, who goes by the name Zee Zee, filmed herself getting ready to leave the hospital after giving birth via C-section - but not before she put her war paint on. For more of the news you care about straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here The mum, who posts under the handle @mamazeezee, filmed herself drawing on her eyebrows, putting on primer, applying foundation, and then contouring her face. She also applies eyeshadow, blusher and highlighter before completing her look with mascara. In another shot, the new mum chows down a delicious-looking taco, with the caption: Break time, Iaposm hungry. After replenishing her energy supply, Zee Zee then pulls out her lashes and glue and applies those too. Finally, she applies lip liner and lipstick before putting a setting spray on her face.  In the final shot, Zee Zee turns the camera to face her boyfriend, who has been watching her apply her make-up while he holds the baby, with a baffled look on his face. She writes: My boyfriend judging me. In another video, Zee Zee, who has a knack for make-up, films herself applying a full face once again when she gets home - and she even curls her locks to complete the look. People impressed with her skills commented on her videos to tell Zee Zee they would have done exactly the same thing. One woman wrote: I hope I have this same energy after this baby in July. Another said: So happy seeing women take such good care of themselves after having a baby get it girl! But most people were baffled at how Zee Zee could have managed to put on a full face of make up so soon after a C-section. One wrote: After my C section I was Living like a grandma, the pain was terrible i couldnapost take care of my self well done girl you are amazing [sic] Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON HospitalsGiving birthViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man defeated after unknowingly scoffing
story: Man defeated after unknowingly scoffing Cadbury Creme Egg worth up to £kA man is facing utter defeat after realising he ate a Cadburys Creme Egg that was worth up to £, - as he had no idea about the annual egg hunt promotionThe man was so frustrated at himself for eating the eggImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments If you cast your mind back to the beginning of , you might remember that Cadbury brought back its Creme Egg hunt by hiding  half white, half milk chocolate Creme Eggs in UK shops - with top prizes of up to £,.Chocolate lovers still have one week left to find a winning egg before the hunt comes to an end on March , and all you have to do is track down one of the rare eggs and resist the urge to scoff it. But it seems one man on Reddit didnapost get the memo, as he admitted he only recently found out about the special prize-winning eggs - just hours after polishing off a half white, half milk chocolate Creme Egg.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.The student, who posted his story anonymously, confessed he had no idea that the egg was special until he saw an advert for the promotion just a few hours later when he had already eaten the chocolate treat and thrown the foil wrapper in a public bin.He said: I am an international student studying in the UK, and so I don’t really keep up with the ads here. A few months ago, Cadbury released  prize-winning eggs across the country with the chance of winning a range of cash prizes including £, .Long story short, I was scrolling through Instagram today and saw the prize-winning egg that looked identical to the one I ate a couple of hours ago. It then dawned on me. I potentially ate £,. The manaposs blunder has left him facing utter defeat as he comes to terms with the potential jackpot he missed out on, as he added: I don’t actually know what  to say other than utter defeat. I think I have officially hit the lowest point in the short  years of my le. While finding one of the rare Creme Eggs is a dficult task in itself, the chances of actually bagging £, are very slim - as only six of the  winning eggs are actually worth the top prize. The six eggs were hidden in an Asda, Co-op, Tesco, Sainsbury’s, Morrisons and an independent retailer, while a further three eggs worth £, on sale in a Waitrose, One Stop and a Booker shop.  Four eggs worth £, are being sold across Iceland and Booths stores, and there are  eggs with prizes of £, while the rest are scattered throughout participating retailers and are worth £ each. Commenters on the Reddit post were sympathetic to the manaposs plight, but many of them suggested he may be able to salvage his prizehe kept hold of his wrapper. One person claimed: To claim, you simply call a number that’s printed on the tin foil wrapping of the winning egg. While another added: Thataposs irrelevant. Evenyou ate the egg, the code you need is on the wrapper, you donapost need the egg itself. So you enjoyed the chocolate, get the packaging out of the bin and collect your winnings! Unfortunately for the student, he had been eating his egg while out and about - so threw the foil wrapper into a public bin and was unable to retrieve it. However, terms and conditions for the Cadbury Creme Egg hunt state that a picture of you not eating your winning egg may be required via email to prove that youaposre the rightful owner of the winning egg. Prizes must be claimed by June ,  and you’ll have to call a number that is printed on the tin foil wrapping of your winning egg to register your win. Andyou really canapost resist the urge to scoff your winning egg, Cadbury has teamed up with sustainable fashion brand Rua Carlota to create a line of clothing that makes it impossible to actually eat the chocolate treats. The line includes a top, balaclava, and gloves, and will be available for one day only on Friday  March at am, via the Rua Carlota website.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Cadbury Ltd.ChocolateFood" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man disturbed house rightmove 189k
story: Man disturbed by house on Rightmove for £k - as its got crime scene tape insideA house hunter was left feeling disturbed after browsing properties on Rightmove and coming across a three-bedroom property for £, that he thought had crime scene tape insideThe house for sale is on the market for £, Image: RightmoveByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterLucas Cumiskey:,  Mar |commentsWhen looking at properties for sale online, house hunters will likely have a list of requirements for their ideal home. And theyaposll also have some things that will put them off a place almost instantly. For one man, spotting what he thought to be aposcrime scene tapeapos inside a three-bedroom terraced home for sale in Preston, wasnapost a big selling point.The man was looking through Rightmove when he came across the house, which is on the market for £,.Images on the listing show that the toilet, taps in the bathroom, kitchen, fridge, fireplaces and even the boiler are covered in blue and white hazard-style tape similar to that used by homicide police.  One concerned viewer said: I found this property on Rightmove. And itaposs covered in police crime scene tape. Did the seller estate agent not think about removing it first  However, on closer inspection, it seems all is not as it initially appears as the tape is emblazoned with aposDo not useapos, whereas crime scene tape often features cordons splashed with aposPoliceapos or aposPolice line do not crossapos. There is no suggestion the pad in Preston, Lancs, was actually a crime scene. On the contrary, Taylors Estates claims the address is quite the steal as it has two bathrooms and boasts views of the River Ribble.  The estate agent adds: With parking available at the front of the property on the road, the house offers a small front courtyard style garden which leads to the front door and into an entrance vestibule. Continuing into the property and into the main hall you are met with the main open staircase on the left-hand side of the building and your first reception room on the right which boasts a great bay window to allow a flood of light. In the middle of the house sits the second reception room with a good-sized kitchen dinner to the rear of the house and utility sitting at the back. The back garden again is a small but cosy sized courtyard. The first floor houses the three double bedrooms with the master at the front of the house which is accompanied by an ensuite with toilet and walk-in shower. The house was added to Rightmove on Monday.Do you have a story to sell  We want to hear all about it. title: man jokily writes naughty dogs
story: Man jokily writes naughty dogs name in mud after she destroys living roomThe Great Dane covered her owners cream carpets in soil but Sam Roberts saw the funny side to his dogs creation - and even signed her name in the artwork when cleaning it upNelly wrecked her owners living room while he was out Image: Triangle NewsByLucas CumiskeyPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsWhen welcoming a dog into your home, owners should expect a certain level of destruction to unfold courtesy of their new four-legged friend.But one owner got more than he bargained for after his Great Dane trashed his house while he was out. Shocked Sam Roberts came home to find his dog - called Nelly - had gone barking mad and wrecked his living room.He had only popped out for a few hours and left her unattended. But the bored -month-old pooch tore up a plant with soil covering the cream carpet and the sofa messed up. The pup - sporting a cone collar - looked sheepish about the destruction she had caused.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.She was lying on a mound of the mess, atop an upturned sofa cushion, with the soil, shredded plant leaves and other chewed up trinkets scattered around. But the -year-old saw the funny side and even wrote his pet’s name in the soil for a laugh while cleaning up. A dramatic after snap shows Nelly snuggling up on the sofa in a tidied up living room. The HGV mechanic said: “We left Nelly on her own for a couple of hours.“She had fun to say the least.” Sam, of Conwy, north Wales, added: “We were that shocked that we just laughed to be honest “We have been leaving her quite a bit for four hours ish and she’s good as gold, and last Saturday we left her for three hours and that’s what happened.” Fellow Great Dane owners shared their own horror stories in reaction to Nelly’s antics. One woman said: “Been there, done that and after his total destruction he had absolute atomic poo-poos all through the house. “One look at his adorable face and all was forgiven, had me totally wrapped around his giant paws.” Another added: “That lampshade cone obviously did all the damage. Great job on cleaning up! Glad to see the sofa and carpet survived so well!” A third woman quipped: “Jeez, Iaposm so pleased sheaposs OK and survived the house tornado.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Great DaneTeamDogsDogsAnimals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man says dodged bullet savage
story: Man says he dodged a bullet in savage response to date who called him fatA man has shared his brutal dating experience online after he was stood up and called fat by the woman he hoped to meet - but he thinks hes dodged a bulletThe man was baffled by his dates text messagesImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |commentsWho among us hasnapost been on at least one bad date Whether you just donapost gel with the person, or they do something that really gets on your nerves, enduring a dficult time is all part and parcel of the dating scene - especially when youaposre meeting someone for the first time. But one man on Reddit has been having a particularly tricky time after his Tinder date completely stood him up and refused to meet with him, as she claimed he was too fat. The -year-old man shared his story anonymously and claimed he was due to meet up with a woman heaposd met online, but when she saw him from afar she decided he wasnapost her cup of tea - and bolted from the date.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. In screenshots of their texts posted in the Tinder forum on Reddit, the woman said: I just saw you from afar and Iaposm sorry I canapost meet you. I donapost like guys who are too fat, Iaposm not attracted to them. Iaposm sorry so itaposs better for me to go back home than to pretend I like you. Good luck with our upcoming dates on Tinder. The man was understandably baffled by the womanaposs message, especially as he pointed out there are pictures of him on Tinder that show his full body - including one of him shirtless. But she pressed on, stating: I thought you were less fat. If that wasnapost enough, the woman also took aim at the manaposs age, claiming there was no way he could be  and insisting he looked closer to .  She said: Itaposs better that way than pretending I like you. And you donapost look , you look like youaposre much older. You look like youaposre , maybe I know because you havenapost found a girlfriend yet. Take care of yourself more. When the woman doubled down even further and told the man to go to the gym some time, the man decided heaposd finally had enough and snapped back. He told her: Iaposm the one dodging a bullet here. And in the title of his Reddit post, he explained: My first tinder experience in a long time. I’m not the smallest weighing in at kgs and ’”. I don’t know how she couldn’t tell I’m the size I am considering I have my gut out on my tinder profile and my Instagram isn’t making me look skinny either.Commenters on the post were firmly on the manaposs side, as many of them took the time to make sure he knew to ignore her shallow comments. One said: You looked great in those pictures bro. She’s too immature for you and apparently extremely shallow. As another added: You look great and you deserve worlds better. I want to personally thank her for not wasting your time. While others were left suspicious of the woman, as they thought she could be a catfish who is making up excuses not to meet with him so she doesnapost expose her true identity. Someone said: I don’t know why but I just have this feeling you were being catfished. It just seems like a ton of projection. But in any case, that was really hurtful and I’m sorry you went through that experience. That is a truly unhappy person to speak to someone that way. And a second person agreed, stating: I‘m reading catfish from this situation too. It just seems too much like someone deliberately trying to bring you down in the cruelest way possible.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON DatingUmm what " data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. permanently tattooed onto her face - but she soon regretted it and wanted it removed.Permanent make-up is all the rage at the minute with people paying to get their favourite designs done by a title: woman praises flight attendant helping
story: Woman praises flight attendant for helping after creepy passenger left her in tearsA woman has recounted how she was left in tears when the passenger she was sat next to on a plane began acting inappropriately but thankfully kind staff stepped in to helpMelanie was left very disturbed by the incident Image: @aiengir TikTokByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar |commentsFar too many of us have ended up stuck with someone behaving in a creepy way while travelling on trains, buses, or aeroplanes, but just because this is common, doesnapost mean it should be accepted. A young woman has shared how she was left disturbed during a flight after the man seated next to her began acting inappropriately, making her feel so uncomfortable that she claims she cried for ten minutes.During a recent flight, where there were only two seats per row on the plane, a model and actress named Melanie found herself sat in the window seat, with an old guy - who she didnapost know - beside her in the aisle seat.According to Melanie, the man proceeded to use both armrests, leaving her without an armrest and squished up against the window. But this wasnapost the worst part. Already feeling annoyed by the situation, Melanie says she looked over at the man, only to see that he was typing the words sex on a plane into his phone, before proceeding to watch videos of people doing it on a plane.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.In a video uploaded to TikTok Melanie said: I know it had something to do with the fact that I was sitting next to him because Iaposm a young, attractive female, and heaposs a creep.So I get really scared and uncomfortable and I go aposexcuse me!apos to him, and then he gets up and moves because I was trying to get up, and I sprint to the front of the plane and I find the flight attendants. At this point, Melanie says she was already crying and freaking out, explaining to her followers that she has been sexually assaulted in the past, a factor that only added to her panic about the situation. After Melanie told the flight attendants what was going on, they kindly went back to get her stuff from her seat for her, as she was too scared toto the row where the man was sitting. They get my stuff from my seat and they move me to first class, and for the whole flight I was crying and trying to calm down and move on, she explains. Itaposs okay, Iaposm very grateful that the flight attendants helped me, Iaposm glad that I was able to remove myself from the situation. Who knows what would have happenedIaposd have stayed there   In a TikTok clip that has since gone viral, Melanie - who goes by the username @ aiengir - can be seen sitting safely in first-class, sticking her tongue out cheekily at her followers as she lets them know what had unfolded.Many people have praised Melanie for coming forward about what had happened to her, with one follower writing: The fact that you said something is so commendable because a situation like that you can feel so frozen and scared. Another said: I’m so sorry that happened to you, that’s so scary but I’m glad you were able to get help and got your seat moved.Do you have a plane travel-related story to share  We pay for stories. title: womans three days horror after
story: Womans three days of horror after dog swallows her wedding ringOwner Shyler Brianne Kraus was unable to play with Finn while working from home but not wanting to take not right now as an answer, the cheeky pooch plotted his revengeFinn ate his owners ring when her back was turned Image: Shyler Brianne KrausByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsWhen welcoming a dog into your home, you sign yourself up as their primary care giver, meaning youaposre responsible for keeping them happy and healthy. While theyaposre able to provide you with unconditional love and companionship, they cannot clean up after themselves and rely on you to collect their aposofferingsapos dotted around the garden.But one owner got more than she bargained for when it comes to poo picking-up duties, as she ended up mushing her dogaposs waste for three and a half days straight in search for her missing wedding ring.Owner Shyler Brianne Kraus, who works from home, was in the midst of an important Zoom call when her dog, Finn, was playing with his toys in another room. She said: Usually my working from home consists of him still getting whatever attention he wants but since this was such an important meeting, I wasn’t doting on him like I normally would.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  Halfway through the meeting I could hear him playing with something metallic because I could hear the little ting sounds from his teeth and nails. I’m not sure how I knew but in the moment I just knew it was my wedding ring. He did what any rational-thinking puppy would do -eat the most valuable item in my possession in order to teach me a lesson. I left my wedding ring on my bedside table, a mistake I no longer make, and he was able to hop up onto my bed and snatch it. Kind of a aposI’ll show her! She can’t work when I want to playapos. Seconds after Shyleraposs meeting ended, Finn wandered into the room and sat behind her impatiently waiting for her to start playing with him. After an unsuccessful search for her wedding ring, she ended up rushing Finn to the vets to get an X-ray. Despite being fed a bunch of high-fibre food at the vets, Finn did not make any aposofferingsapos, and Shyler was told to go home and examine his poo until her rings shows up. Thursday night: no ring. Friday morning: no ring. Friday midday: no ring, said Shyler, from Decatur, Illinoi. We brought him back to the vets office for another X-ray to be safe and to schedule a aposjust in caseapos X-ray for Mondayhe hadn’t produced it over the weekend. All weekend long, I mushed poo pile after poo pile. I’ve never been so grateful to have a mask to wear and still my dog’s stomach remained my grossest jewellery box. On Monday, a very stressful day for us, we discovered that after three and a half days my ring had started to make the journey to Finn’s forbidden zone. Thanks to my mother-in-law’s incredible cooking, my father-in-law always throwing Finn an extra treat or two, and my husband’s frantic games of fetch and ball catch, we got the ring back! Dramatic Finn was unknowingly just  minutes away from being taken back to the vets to undergo a surgery to remove the ring.Shyler added: Special thanks to the team at Northgate Pet Clinic- Decatur, IL who went above and beyond for my little furry terror and helped me see the humour in the situation with these X-ray pictures.He’s actually quite the legend at the vet’s office now too! title: little girl beautiful voice made
story: Little girl with beautul voice made the world weep for children of UkraineThere has never been a more powerful version of Let It Go, Polly Hudson says of the footage from an underground bunker, reminding us how lives have been turned upside down for millions of innocentsAmelia singing in the bunker Image: PAopinionByPolly Hudson:,  Mar |commentsIt’s the chaos surrounding her that you notice first. The ­desperate families squeezed in, standing, sitting, lying wherever they can, next to their precariously piled ­belongings, packed into the dank underground space they now call home. There’s an air of restlessness, a palpable sense of tension and anxiety. How could there not be And then, completely unexpectedly, something magical happens. Little Amelia – age unknown, but probably, what, seven or eight  – stands up on a chair. She’s wearing a sparkly jumper with stars on it, from HM a few years ago – my friend’s daughter has the same one and still loves it too. Hands clenched together shyly, unbrushed hair pulled back into a ponytail, Amelia plucks up all her courage, opens her mouth and starts to sing Let It Go, from Frozen. And like a spell cast in the movie her song comes from, the Kyiv shelter falls silent. Everyone turns and gives this small blonde scrap of a girl their mesmerised full attention. No one moves. Babies stop crying. This captive audience cannot take their eyes off her, as they listen to her sweet, steady voice, a chink of shining light in the unimaginable ­darkness of Ukraine.She has given these people the gt of focusing on something other than the living nightmare they’re enduring, albeit briefly, and there isn’t a dry eye in the room. Or from any of the millions around the globe who have since watched the video on social media.Despite probably never having heard Ukrainian before, the song is in the universal language of Disney, kids from any country in the world watching it could name that tune in three. In the caption, the woman who posted it explains that Amelia told her she wanted to be “a singer on a grand stage” – an ambition now fulfilled, just not in a way anyone would want. Their poor parents can, at least, try to fight back, but the children of Ukraine are utterly defenceless in this war. Putin is torturing and traumatising these pure, faultless human beings, turning them into orphans. Murdering  of them.  Amelia and the other kids in that shelter, and similar ones across the country. Danya and Mpak, the boys trapped in Calais, denied entry by our callous government because they don’t have the right paperwork. The -year-old who braved a -mile journey to safety alone. Heroic President Volodymyr Zelensky’ s own children – Aleksandra, , and Kiril, age nine – who have targets on their backs. Polina, the girl with the pink hair, and her brother Semyon, both dead. And the many other nameless young casualties.All entirely blameless, innocent children – just like their entirely blameless, innocent mums and dads – frightened for their lives.  Two weeks ago they were moaning about homework, playing with their friends, not eating their vegetables. Now, suddenly plunged into a reality where growing up without their fathers may well be the best case scenario. The least worst of their horrendous options. When Let It Go lyricist Kristen Anderson-Lopez saw Amelia’s rendition, she tweeted: “Dear Little Girl with the beautul voice, my husband and I wrote this song. The way you sing it is like a magic trick that spreads the light in your heart and heals everyone who hears it.” She finished by urging Amelia to “Keep singing!” If only that choice was hers. title: man called little john who
story: Man called Little John who lives in a cave sees his dad for first time in  yearsThe -year-old lives in a cave in Otago, New Zealand performs dentistry on himself and doesnt collect any benefit to surviveLittle John, who has lived in a cave for a decade, has been reunited with his dad after  years Image: stuff.co.nzByLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Mar |commentsA man called aposLittle Johnapos who has lived in a cave for the last decade has been reunited with his dad for the first time in  years. The -year-old, who lives out in Otago on New Zealandaposs South Island, lives an extraordinary le which involves performing dentistry on himself and not collecting any benefit to survive. There was no particular animosity or argument in the family that broke them apart - but the separation came after the death of Little Johnaposs brother which hit everyone very hard. Little John was battling addictions and watched the collapse of his relationship - and thataposs when he moved out to live in the cave. And he hasnapost moved for the last  years. After publication Stuff shared Little Johnaposs story, his family, including his sister based in Australia, got in touch saying they were so grateful for the words about him.Little Johnaposs sister said: It feels like a weight has been lted, no longer fearing the worst and wondering where he was. It also caused his father, who Stuff agreed not to name and who is based in Dunedin, New Zealand, to contact a foodbank to try to track him down. Michelle Kerr, from the Mosgiel Community Foodbank, told  News it was a huge step for him. Little John explained that he knew his fatheraposs address but hadnapost visited him since he moved to the South.  But on Wednesdaythe father and son were finally reunited after  years apart. Little Johnaposs dad said it was a wonderful experience. The pair enjoyed a meal and spent quality time together - Little John even spoke to his sister in Australia. Little John even found out his mother had died in . The father and son decided they plan to see each other again in the future.  Living several kilometers away from the closest human structure, Little John said itaposs there that he found peace with God and became close with his fellow Christians.Little John himself said the Stuff article had helped him too as he has been able to form bonds with local residents. Where previously they were wary of picking him up, he can now hitchhike. And a few weeks ago Little John said he heard people calling his name who had obviously gone looking for him. Struggling to find his cave at first, they began calling his name, to which he replied Gaposday. Little John said he had had some offers from hopeful aposcave womenapos, but not as many as he wanted. He particularly likes the cold months in the Otago caves and plans to spend winter there. Explaining why he lives in the cave he said for me itaposs natural, and natural is healthy.  He also doesnapost want to claim the unemployment benefit or eventually the pension because he said the money would give him access to his addictions. Little John explained heaposs always had a problem with booze and smokes but now he smokes and drinks much less basically because he canapost afford it. He has given up on Government support, come off the dole and closed his bank account in what he describes as a really big step. Doing odd jobs and using food banks, he gets by on around  a year. Little John added that he lives in a cave because itaposs free but also because nobody bugs him there. news world-news russian-state-tv-broadcasts-stinging-"Zelensky urges Russians to speak out against PutinByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Russian state TV guests have hit out at the invasion of Ukraine and risked the wrath of Vladimir Putin by defying him on a popular primetime show.Thousands of people have been protesting in Russian cities following the invasion of their neighbouring country, with many seeing Ukrainians as their brothers, and authorities have threatened critics of the war with  years in jail. But with state media having backed the Ukrainian invasion the majority of Russians appear to seemingly be in support of the invasion - and it is Putinaposs control over journalists that has helped him to rule without any signicant opposition. Now, though, on a programme hosted by Vladimir Soloviyev, a staunch supporter of Putin’s regime, guests openly criticised the attack on Ukraine with one saying it was like “Afghanistan but even worse.” The use of Afghanistan as an example is signicant in Russia as it is seen as a military humiliation - with the country having spent  years in the country before withdrawing in . Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletin here Soloviyev has been pedalling state propaganda even agreeing that the shelling of a maternity hospital in Mariupol this week was “fake news” - claiming the building was now being used by Ukraine troops.He was left fuming, though, by comments on his Thursday night show where they questioned what the Russians were doing in Ukraine.Karen Shakhbnazarov, a filmmaker and political commentator, took a dig at the decision to invade Ukraine on the Russia  channel. “The war in Ukraine paints a frightening picture, it has a very oppressive influence on our society. Ukraine, whichever way you see it, is somewhere with which Russia has thousands of human links, he said, reported the Daily Beast.  The suffering of one group of innocents does not compensate for the suffering of other innocent people... I don’t see the probability of denazication of such an enormous country. We would need to bring in . million soldiers to control all of it. He added: The most important thing in this scenario is to stop our military action. Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletin here Shakhbnazarov did toe the country’s line that the war was caused by the United States but he said that a “humanitarian disaster” would also see Russia’s allies like China and India distancing themselves.  The host, who is one the Russians to have been sanctioned by the EU and has had an Italian villa seized, was left annoyed by the analysis but other guests were also critical. Semyon Bagdasarov, a Russian Middle East expert, agreed with Shakhbnazarov and said that Russians need to prepare for total isolation. He drew the parallels with Afghanistan saying: Let Ukrainians do this denazication on their own. We can’t do it for them... As for their neutrality, yes, we should squeeze it out of them, and that’s it.  We don’t need to stay there longer than necessary... Do we need to get into another Afghanistan, but even worse  There are more people and they’re more advanced in their handling of weapons. We don’t need that. Enough already... As for the sanctions, the world has never seen such massive sanctions.” Other media shows have also given an insight into the war casualties in Ukraine with Russian soldiers dying, which is also going against the official line that the battle is going according to plan. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. title: grew-glasgow-wedding-scrammel-big-event-bridgeton-kids
story: Earliest memory: The ‘scrammel’: the big event of a taxi coming into the otherwise car-free street to take a bride to church and the bride’s father throwing coins out as they drove off for us kids toscramble for them.

title: remembering-comedian-tommy-morgan-king-glasgow-patter
story: Much-admired and much loved Glasgow comedian Tommy Morgan was born in Bridgeton in , the son of a trades union activist. He became a huge music hall star in the s, s and s, starring in numerous pantos and shows across Scotland. Glasgow audiences loved his cheeky face and gallus chat and he was often seen on stage at the likes of the Pavilion and the pole.

title: remembering-lord-provost-pat-lally---lazarus-glasgow-politics
story: The Glasgow politician nicknamed Lazarus because of his many comebacks was a passionate supporter of the city and a proud Glaswegian. Pat Lally was born in  and brought up in the Gorbals, and worked initially in the clothing trade before serving as a radar operator in the RAF during the Second World War.

title: historic-glasgow-rail-works-become-listed-building
story: IT WAS once at the heart of the world’s locomotive construction – and it is one of the few remaining works of its kind in Scotland.

title: singer-eddi-reader-discovers-gran-secret-life-footballer
story: SINGER Eddi Reader remembers her uncle telling them he’d play football out on the Bilsland Drive back courts and the cry from local men was always the same.

title: glasgow-weekend
story: If you’ve spent the past five days looking forward to the weekend, now you’ll be looking for some fun activities to do.

title: bloc-glasgow-unveil-burger-turkey-dinosaurs-potato-smiles
story: A POPULAR city centre eatery has unveiled an eclectic new burger recipe that will be a blast from the past for many of our readers.

title: line-duty-greenock-born-martin-shares-love-ardgowan-hospice
story: MARTIN Compston is bringing his AC- co-stars together in aid of a very special cause that is close to his heart.

title: line-duty-reunion-five-shows-jaw-dropping-moments
story: LINE of Dutys stars will be appearing at the first reunion since it ended, as Martin Compston, Adrian Dunbar and Vicky McClure, as well as showrunner Jed Mercurio, dish the dirt and raise money for a good cause, with a recording of the event exclusively available to subscribers of this title.

story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. title: singh for your supper
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles.
